revised_title: Exploring the Effects of Temperature and Nutrients on Cell Division and Extension
tldr: Researchers R. Brown and P. Rickless developed a new method to study cell division and extension in plant root meristems. They found that cell division is affected by the presence of sugar, inorganic salts, and yeast extract, while cell extension depends on a balance of sugar, inorganic salts, and protein synthesis. The study also showed that root growth is faster at 15°C compared to 25°C and 5°C.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
